roleset.name: remove

example.name: just transitive
example.text: In a surprise move, [the British government]-1 cleared the way for a bidding war for Jaguar PLC by [*trace*-1]-2 agreeing *trace*-2 to remove an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker.
example.arg: an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker

example.name: arg2 as source
example.text: It includes *trace* removing $242 million in good will from the books...

example.name: arg2 as role
example.text: The announcement effectively removes the British government as an impediment to a takeover of the company, which is being stalked by General Motors and Ford.
example.arg: as an impediment to a takeover of the company, which is being stalked by General Motors and Ford
example.note: Note that this could be rephrased as "...removes the British government from being an impediment..." or "...removes the British government from its role as an impediment..." or whatever. That shows that the as-phrase is the same as a from-phrase.

roleset.note: Comparison with 'eliminate'. Member of Vncls remove-10.1, banish-10.2, fire-10.10. Updated by Julia, 10/2010.

frameset.note: Frames file for 'remove' based on sentences in financial subcorpus.
